issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Dialogs should recenter when they change size

comments.body: This is annoying, would be nice to fix.

Edited issue title. 

----- "Jenny Loza (JIRA)" wrote: 

-- 
Ean Schuessler, CTO 
ean@brainfood.com 
214-720-0700 x 315 
Brainfood, Inc. 
http://www.brainfood.com

Maybe I misunderstood this bug. I understood it as, when the size of the browser changes, the dialogs should be showing up at the center. When I checked it, the dialogs are already centered based on the window size.

Could you provide more details on what the exact issue is here?

Nevermind. Understood the issue. The dialogs need to be centered automatically when the size of the window is changing while the dialogs is in display.

Fixed by adding window's resize event.

Oh no, actually when the dialog changes size. For instance, in "launch more" when you expand the advanced section. 

----- "Kyo Lee (JIRA)" wrote: 

-- 
Ean Schuessler, CTO 
ean@brainfood.com 
214-720-0700 x 315 
Brainfood, Inc. 
http://www.brainfood.com

Added a line in the dialogs, "Launch More Like This" and "Create Launch Config", to make them re-center the dialog when the advanced section is open.

If there are more dialogs need the treatment above, please reject the patch and leave the comment here.

The added line is:

self.$el.dialog("option", "position", "center");
[~kyolee] Edit scaling group properties falls off the bottom of the page

I see what the issue is here.

When the dialog gets positioned on the screen, the size of the dialog is computed by the entire size of the dialog, including the hidden away view. In our case, some dialogs, such as the edit scaling group dialog and etc, have huge "help" messages hidden away from the initial view. Thus, the entire browser window size gets pushed down to make a bigger room for this dialog, and for this reason, the initial view, which only reveals the top portion of the dialog gets placed awkwardly.

I do not see an immediate solution for this issue other than improving the "help" dialog so that it won't be included as a hidden view from the initial loading of the dialog.
The dialogs with the tabs get centered in a different way due to the post loading of the content. Will need to re-examine this case.

New pull request has been submitted:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/54

With the new commit 59f1372, the dialog position adjustment function has been added to the timer event to trigger the re-center after the tab content has been loaded.

Be aware of the sudden jump in the dialog's position after the adjustment event gets triggered after the timer has been expired. There is no way of getting around that issue for now.

New pull request has been submitted:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/54
Jerry has reviewed and merged the pull request to the branch 'testing'
Verified that they are now resizing.
